PLACES OF WORSHIP(ENFRANCHISEMENT) BILL
PRIVATE MEMBER'S BILL.
(i) Copy of letter from the Prime Minister to Mr. H.A.L. Fisher.
(ii) Copy of letter from Mr. John Hinds. M.P. to the Prime Minister.
(iii) Draft Bill.
Downing street,
Whitehall, S.W.I.
June 4th, 1920.
Dear Mr. Fisher.
I am desired by the Prime Minister to forward you the enclosed letter in regard to the Places of Worship (Enfranchisement ) Bill, and to say he is anxious that facilities should be granted for the passing of this bill. With this object in view, he will be glad if you will kindly have it considered soon by the Home Affairs Committee.
The Bill has been before Parliament on two or three occasions previously, and Mr. Lloyd George believes that it would be accepted in a non-controversial spirit.
Yours sincerely
(signed) ERNEST EVANS.
Rt. Hon.
H.A.L. Fischer, M.P.
